The Special Collections Department 11120

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: Stereoscopic views of various Virginia places and scenes.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Stereographs, 1907, 1912, n.d., Accession #11120, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These stereoscopic views were purchased by the Library from Jerry N. Showalter, Bookseller, Ivy, Virginia, on November 5, 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of stereoscopic views of various Virginia places and scenes: Randolph-Macon Academy, Front Royal; West Point Cadets at the Jamestown Exposition; Luray Caverns; and Clouden Saw Mills, Dumfries.

did.unittitle: Front Royal - Randolph-Macon Academy - view from Town and a Group of Teachers and Students n.d.
Jamestown Exposition - Drill of the West Point Cadets, Lee's Parade Ground 1907
Page County - Luray Caverns - Hanging Rock 1912
Prince William County - Dumfries - Clouden Saw Mills n.d.
